title: Ticket #7626: Advertise SubmitterLimit in the accounting ad
description: When the matchmaker hands out matches, it tries to hand out a "fair share" to each submitter. However, if a submitter has job that don't match many resources, it can be under the "fair share". This may cause another submitter to be over the fair share. We'd like to log and graph these over time, so let's add the submitter limit, or how many cores a submitter is entitled to, so we can see how well we are doing.
remarks:
2020-May-01 10:08:36 by tannenba:
The patch adds not only SubmitterLimit, but also SubmitterShare which is not discussed above... what is the share -vs- the limit? Thanks

2020-May-01 10:22:14 by gthain:
Following the naming in the negotiator, the share is the percentage, independent of the pool size, so something like .25. The limit is the absolute number, the share * the pool size.

2020-May-01 10:23:19 by gthain:
Rolling this out on OSG has revealed a bug -- if NEGOTIATOR_CONSIDER_PREEMPTION is false, the pool size is trimmed to number of idle slots, so both the share and the limit are way too low.
